item.description:
This hike is new to us and thus experimental. This looks to be an interesting preserve (157 acres) with dry oak woods, massive rock outcrops, and a rock bluff with a view toward the south. This hike is an out-and-back hike of about 3 to 3.5 miles total and easy to moderate in effort with a higher rating due to some potential steepness in parts.

When getting to the preserve from Rte. 9, take Exit 10, turn left (north) on Route 154 (Old Saybrook Road), and continue for 0.7 mile. Turn right onto Dripps Road (a dirt road) and go 500 feet (it immediately bends to the right at a junction with the preserve’s entrance at an old grassy lane). Entrance is on the left and the trail is blazed white. Park on the side of the road.

We will take up to 2.5 hrs. for this hike and be done by about 10:30 AM at the latest!

Those who wish to go need to have:
* 1 quart of water
* Hiking boots
* Dress in layers - So you can take off as you heat up, no cotton

Optional equipment:
* A daypack - for carrying water and removed layers
* Bug spray
* Camera
* Hiking pole(s)

The number of parking spaces is unknown and thus has set a limit for attendance on this hike.

Dogs are allowed but must be leashed.

Approximate location/directions parking on shoulder of road (around 50 Dripps Rd., Middletown, CT):
http://mapq.st/JWhdUP

Hiking Map - Middletown Hiking Guide (see pages 30-31)
http://www.google.com/url?sa=t&rct=j&q=nature%20conservancy%20spiderweed%20preserve&source=web&cd=5&ved=0CDsQFjAE&url=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.middletownplanning.com%2Fdocuments%2FMdtnTrailGuide.pdf&ei=VKiiT_nSAeTh0wH48f3UDA&usg=AFQjCNEnewSb3wt2M-n_6U0iwup0yVKKiw

Spiderweed Preserve - More information from the Nature Conservancy which operates it:
http://www.nature.org/ourinitiatives/regions/northamerica/unitedstates/connecticut/placesweprotect/spiderweed-preserve.xml

The Nature Conservancy - Connecticut Chapter - Preserving this land
http://www.nature.org/ourinitiatives/regions/northamerica/unitedstates/connecticut/index.htm

=== Legal Stuff ===

By clicking on "Yes" for this event you agree, warrant, and covenant as follows: In consideration for accepting this entry, I, the registrant, intending to be legally bound, hereby, for myself, my heirs, my executors and administrators, do waive and release any and all rights for damages I may have against any parties or persons connected with the Hartford Area Hiking meetup group for and related to the above listed event. I attest and verify that I am physically fit to participate in any portion of this above listed event. I grant Hartford Area Hiking permission to use any photographs, film or videotapes of this event for any purpose.
item.how_to_find_us: Silver Ford Escape SUV with CT plates, meet at hike location.

group.name: The Hartford Area Hiking™ Meetup Group

item.name: Hike at Spiderweed Preserve in Middletown CT
